Topic.Name: Toolbox Window
Topic.Title: Toolbox Window
Topic.s:
The Toolbox window gives you the possibility to control the drawing of polygons and algorithm results as well as to select what is to be drawn. Additionally it controls the grid.

 

Toolbox Window Options

Here's a list and a short description of the options you can change in the toolbox window. To reset these options to their default values, just click the Reset button in the top right corner of the window.

 

The settings controlled by the toolbox window are:

Polygon Settings:

    • DrawPolygons
      Show or hide user drawn polygons on the drawing area.
    • HighlightSelection
      Highlight (in different color) the polygon selected by the user.
    • ShadePolygons
      Fill polygons with color.

Algorithm Settings:

    • AddLogEntries
      Output algorithm information (e.g. duration, current step, ...) in the log window.
    • BeepOnStep
      Play a sound for each step performed in slow motion or single step mode.
    • ClearLogBeforeRun
      Clear the log window before running an algorithm.
    • DrawAlgorithmData
      Enable or disable the drawing of data resulting from an algorithm (such as diagonals, polygon stack, ...).
    • DrawConnectedPolygons
      Draw connected polygons that resulted from connecting a polygon with the polygons inside it before the triangulation.
    • DrawConnections
      Draw the connection segment used to connect a polygon with the polygons inside it.
    • DrawCurrentState
      Draw the current state of an a algorithm (such as vertices currently being tested, current polygon stack, ...)
    • DrawDiagonals
      Show or hide the diagonals which resulted from running the triangulation.
    • ShadeConnectedPolygons
      Fill the connected polygons that resulted from connecting a polygon with the polygons inside it before the triangulation with color.
    • StepFrequency
      Number of milliseconds to pause between each step in slow motion mode.
    • StepsPerClick
      Number of steps to perform on each click in single step mode. (Usually one)
    • TriangulationLevel
      Triangulate polygons up to this level of depth. (Set to -1 for infinite level, i.e. triangulate all polygons)

Grid Settings:

    • GridWidth
      The width of the grid.
    • ShowGrid
      Enable / disable the grid.
    • SnapToGrid
      Restrict setting polygon vertices to points on the grid.

Log Settings:

    • LogBeepDisabled
      Disable the sound when adding a log entry.
    • LogEnabled
      Enable / disable the log.

Polygon Graphics:

Sets the the colors, line strength and shading opacity for drawing polygons.

    • Polygon*
      Options for polygons drawn by the user.
    • Selection*
      Options for the polygon currently selected by the user.

Algorithm Graphics

Sets the the colors, line strength and shading opacity for algorithm results.

    • ConnectedPolygons*
      Options for polygons that are the result of connecting a given polygon with the polygons inside.
    • Connections*
      Segments used to connect a polygon with the polygons inside it.
    • CurrentPoint*
      Options for points that are currently investigated / tested / being looked at by an algorithm in progress.
    • CurrentSegments*
      Options for segments that are currently investigated / tested / being looked at by an algorithm in progress.
    • Diagonals*
      Options for diagonals that have been found when connecting polygons or during a triangulation process.
    • InvestigatedPolygons*
      Options for polygons that are currently investigated / tested / being looked at by an algorithm in progress.
    • LockedPoint*
      Options for points that have yet been identified to match a certain criteria while other points are still being tested by an algorithm in progress (e.g. points currently closest to another point while testing other points if they are closer to it).
    • LockedSegment*
      Options for segments that have yet been identified to match a certain criteria while other segments are still being tested by an algorithm in progress (e.g. segments that are intersecting with a certain segment while other segments are being tested for intersection).
    • StackedPolygons*
      Options for polygons that have been pushed on a stack during an algorithm in process and still need to be treated.

Grid Graphics

Sets the the color and line strength for the grid.
